subject: Re: [junit] How to test assertXXX() method for multi set of data
msgSnippet: ... I am not sure I undestand what you are asking. Nonetheless, this is the point of testing. If you get an unexpected result, it means either you code has a
messageBody:
--- Anil Devrao J <anildevrao.jadhav@...> wrote:

>
> Hi All,
>
> Implementation method:
>
> boolean aMethod(int a, int b)
> {
> ----------;
> ----------;
> ----------;
> return bval;
> }
>
> I want to test above method for n number of valid data sets. But whenever I
> am testing it by using following method and if I got any unexpected result
> in first data set then its not testing for remaining data sets.
>
> public void testaMethod()
> {
> int a[] = new int[10];
> int b[] = new int[10];
> for(int i =0; i< 10; i++)
> {
> try
> {
> assertTrue(obj.aMethod(a[i], b[i])
> }
> catch(Exception e)
> {}
> }
>


I am not sure I undestand what you are asking. Nonetheless, this is the point
of testing.

If you get an unexpected result, it means either you code has a bug or your
test case is not valid (which blows up the point of testing in the first
place).


If you want to test for a input that is not valid then you must created a
second test case (or method) as in the following:


int a_valid_input[] = new int[10];
int b_valid_input[] = new int[10];

int a_invalid_input[] = new int[10];
int b_invalid_input[] = new int[10];


for(int i =0; i< 10; i++)
{
// test for valid input
assertTrue(obj.aMethod(a_valid_input[i], b_valid_input[i]);

// test for invalid input (It must return false, since it is invalid.
//
assertFalse(obj.aMethod(a_invalid_input[i], b_invalid_input[i]);

}

Hope this helps.

Harring Figueiredo.
